sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: One person has died and some 30 passengers have been injured in a train crash in the Netherlands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Finland becomes NATO's 31st member, completing the fastest succession process in the organization's history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Ukraine denies claims by the Russian mercenary group Wagner that it's taken control of the besieged eastern city of Bakhmut.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: One person has died and some 30 passengers have been injured, many of them seriously, after a train partially derailed in the Netherlands in the early hours of Tuesday morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: One train carriage landed in a field following the accident, which happened at around 3.30 in the morning in the town of Voorshoten near The Hague.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Railway authorities say the presence of a small construction crane on the tracks was the likely cause of the crash.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A new flagpole awaits the Finnish flag at NATO headquarters in Brussels. When the Nordic country becomes the military alliance's 31st member today, it will complete the fastest accession process in the organization's history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg has welcomed the new arrival.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It will be a good day for Finland's security, for Nordic security and for NATO as a whole.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Sweden will also be safer as a result.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Although weekend elections mean Finland looks to have lost the Prime Minister who championed NATO membership, Sanna Marin, the accession has cross-party support. Russia's invasion of Ukraine triggered applications from Finland and Sweden.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Turkey delayed the process, complaining that Finland was supporting terrorists.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And Ankara is still blocking Sweden's application on similar grounds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: NATO sees Finland's membership as an asset.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Unlike most members of the alliance, Finland didn't cut defence spending after the Cold War and has a large, well-trained army.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russia has warned it will bolster its own forces along the Finnish border should NATO troops be deployed there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Residents of the besieged Ukrainian city of Bakhmut loading some of their belongings onto the back of an armoured vehicle.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: They're being helped by Ukrainian soldiers to leave their homes for a place of safety elsewhere in the country. A ghost town, the eastern city was once home to some 70,000 people, but now tanks and armored vehicles patrol the streets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A spokesperson for Ukraine's eastern command has denied Russian claims that Bakhmut has been taken.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The fight for the city has become the longest and bloodiest battle of Russia's assault on Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: has become the longest and bloodiest battle of Russia's assault on Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Overnight, the head of the private mercenary group Wagner claimed it had raised a Russian flag over an administrative building in Bakhmut. He even posted a night vision video of the act, but the location could not be identified. In his nightly address, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the Donetsk region, which includes Bakhmut, is especially hot.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: He is due to visit Poland on Wednesday for talks with his Polish counterpart.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Warsaw has already delivered the first batch of Soviet-era MiG-29 fighter jets to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Russia claims to have killed up to 285 Ukrainian troops in its Donetsk advance and destroyed Ukrainian military hardware.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The first Polish MiG-29 fighter jets have arrived in Ukraine, Warsaw confirmed on Monday,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: now specifying exactly how many aircraft have been sent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Last month, Poland and Slovakia became the first Western countries to announce the shipment of more than 40 MiG fighters to Ukraine, thereby crossing what was until then a red line in sending military equipment to the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The announcement comes ahead of Ukrainian President Zelensky's visit to Warsaw on Wednesday for his first official trip to Poland since the war began. Das Erkennungskonferenz kommt vor dem Besuch des ukrainischen Präsidenten Zelenskys in Warsaw am Montag, für seinen ersten offiziellen Trip nach Polen, seit der Krieg begann.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Mittlerweile kam der deutsche Vize-Chancellor Robert Habeck in Kiew für eine uneröffnete Besuch.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Dass die Ukraine ein klares Zeichen kriegt, dass wir daran glauben, dass sie siegreich sein wird, dass sie wieder aufgebaut wird, dass es ein Interesse von Europa gibt, nicht nur in der Not zu unterstützen, sondern dass die Ukraine auch ein wirtschaftlich starker Partner in der Zukunft sein wird.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Habeck, der auch als Wirtschaftsminister vertreten ist, wurde von einer kleinen Geschäftsdelegation verabschiedet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Der Hauptziel dieser Reise ist es, die Reconstruktion des Landes zu diskutieren und die Kooperation im Energiezentrum. is to discuss the reconstruction of the country and cooperation in the energy sector.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A strong police presence outside Trump Tower ahead of former U.S. President Donald Trump's

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: appearance in court. He arrived in New York on Monday afternoon, spending the night in his private suite, preparing with his lawyers for today's proceedings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Trump is expected to deny wrongdoing when indicted for his alleged role in hush money payments to porn star Stormy Daniels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: He's the first U.S. president in history to face a criminal case.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: There's tight security in New York as the city braces for potential street protests by both his supporters and detractors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The New York Police Department is on high alert ahead of the arraignment ordering its 36,000 officers to be in uniform and ready to deploy. Our message is clear and simple control yourselves. New York City is our home not a playground for your misplaced anger. We are the safest large city in America because we respect the rule of law in New York City. The exact charges to be leveled against Trump are unknown, but his lawyers have said he will plead not guilty. The payment to Stormy Daniels was not illegal, but he allegedly recorded it as a business expense. Pulsifying business records is illegal in New York.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The former president is expected to return to his Florida home after the court releases him on bail.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: These are the scenes of devastation across parts of the U.S.'s South and Midwest

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: following Friday's deadly tornadoes. And now as residents sift through the wreckage of their homes, forecasters are warning of more severe weather in the days ahead. The fierce storms that spawned the tornadoes, killing at least 32 people, were caused by a combination of low pressure and strong winds. Forecasters say those same conditions are now set to return.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Hundreds of firefighters have been battling to control a massive fire

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: that burned through a popular clothing market in the Bangladesh capital, Dhaka.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Bangar Bazaar market is well known as a source of cut-price Western fashion brands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And although no casualties have so far been reported, the blaze has left many shop owners devastated by the loss of their livelihoods.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Fires are common in commercial zones in Bangladesh, with lax monitoring and a lack of fire safety arrangements often to blame.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The first stamps featuring the profile of Britain's King Charles III rolling off the printing press.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Officially, they're due to go on sale at post offices and retailers from today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But, like Charles, who had to wait a long time before succeeding Queen Elizabeth II on the throne, it may be a while before you receive a letter with one on it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Stockists will not be selling them until all the stamps featuring his mother's image have been used up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The format for the stamp is the same as the first one, featuring Queen Victoria in 1840, except that Charles is not seen wearing a crown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: except that Charles is not seen wearing a crown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Following calls by the European Commission to reassess EU diplomatic and economic ties with China, all eyes are now on Ursula von der Leyen's joint trip with the French president to Beijing, where the stakes could not be higher. In 2022, China was the third largest partner for EU goods exports and the largest partner for the bloc's imports of goods, an important indicator of where relations between the two really lie.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: For some experts, this trip will be exploited by Chinese President Xi Jinping.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We have the biggest players, such as Germany and France.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And the business circles in these two countries have very vast, really, really vast interest in terms of returning to business as usual.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And with Macron, this business delegation is definitely a signal towards Beijing that economic cooperation is still very high on the agenda in Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But also, you know, at the level of EU as a whole, and this was very visible in von der Leyen's speech, Europe is not about decoupling, this American-style decoupling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: MALCOLM BRABANT, Von der Leyen has described it as de-risking rather than decoupling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But Bakulska says this won't be easy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: VIKTORIYA BAKULSKA, European Parliament Member But this will be very, very difficult in practice, given the scope of Xi Jinping's revisionism, the way our economy has been politicized in the recent decade, and also given his ambitions, you know, create this dependency to also shield China from external shock.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Macron wants to deter China from getting even closer to Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But some analysts warn that there's not much room to maneuver, given that the nature of relations between Beijing and Moscow is highly strategic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: What the French president and his European Commission counterpart can do is warn China of possible consequences in case of further military support to Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: JOSEPH BIDEN, President of the United States, President Macron, of course, has the legitimacy to ask and raise the issue to China for two reasons. First, France is, of course, a nuclear weapon state. And second, France, unlike the US and the UK, is not part of any nuclear sharing agreement, as these two countries are as part of NATO. France, compared to China, is lightweight today. Even though France is a permanent member of the Security Council, the relationship is very asymmetric. And there is little that Macron can convince Xi Jinping of.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's good to try. It's good, of course, to maintain channel of communication open.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But we need to be very realistic in our expectation and to keep very limited expectation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: At the same time, both experts agree that sensitive technologies are key to this relationship.
